title: AI Healthcare: Can We Trust It With Our Lives?
summary: Google removed its AI healthcare summaries after a BuzzFeed investigation found dangerous inaccuracies. This raises questions about the safety of AI in critical fields like healthcare and how tech companies are handling these issues.
angle: Google's recent removal of AI health summaries due to dangerous flaws highlights critical issues of trust and safety in AI healthcare applications.

sources.title: Google removes some AI health summaries after investigation finds “dangerous” flaws

why_it_works: Taps into major public concern about AI safety and regulation

title: What do the new PC chips mean for the future of AI?
summary: AMD announced the latest version of its AI-powered PC chips designed for a variety of tasks from gaming to content creation and multitasking. This points to a future where we are all going to need to have better machines to keep pace with the AI race.
angle: The idea of what we will need to process the AI tools of the near future is fascinating. I was recently told I need to upgrade my computer to ensure I can continue to use some tools.

sources.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES

why_it_works: Fits perfectly with what we have been working on in our newsletter.

title: The world is already on fire, but we have to talk about Grok and deepfakes
summary: Elon Musk’s Grok is being used to create non-consensual sexual deepfakes of women in religious clothing. And it is not only being allowed, but promoted. This week’s burning question asks if AI is going to create a world of conspiracy theories and we have a tragic lesson about what happens when you use an AI tool that your platform is trying to sell (and it gets the facts of your story wrong).

sources.title: Grok Is Being Used to Mock and Strip Women in Hijabs and Saris
X Didn’t Fix Grok's ‘Undressing’ Problem. It Just Makes People Pay for It

angle: A focus on what Musk is allowed to do (and get away with) despite the grotesque nature of the content being used as a marketing tool for his product.
why_it_works: The Grok story is deeply disturbing and in the public interest to be reported on.

title: OpenAI is asking contractors to upload their work for the benefit of their models… and they’re mad
summary: This week OpenAI was slammed for asking their contractors to upload work from past jobs to evaluate the performance of their AI agents. We’ll explore if this is fair and if it is the future.

sources.title: OpenAI Is Asking Contractors to Upload Work From Past Jobs to Evaluate the Performance of AI Agents
OpenAI is reportedly asking contractors to upload real work from past jobs

angle: This story seems to be the evolution towards how we are all going to have to work in the future and what we will all need to accept.
why_it_works: It taps into people’s fears of how the workplace is changing.

angle: With Meta launching its own AI infrastructure and Anthropic's new healthcare product, the AI arms race is intensifying.

sources.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta is launching its own AI infrastructure initiative
Anthropic announces Claude for Healthcare following OpenAI’s ChatGPT Health reveal

title: The AI Arms Race: Meta and Anthropic's Next Moves
why_it_works: Highlights the competition among tech giants in AI development
summary: Meta is building its own AI infrastructure, and Anthropic has launched a healthcare-focused AI product. These moves show how companies are racing to dominate AI, especially in high-stakes areas like healthcare.

angle: Amazon's acquisition of an AI wearable and its Alexa expansion show a strategy to integrate AI deeply into daily life.

sources.title: Why Amazon bought Bee, an AI wearable
Amazon says 97% of its devices can support Alexa+

title: Amazon's AI Strategy: Wearables and Alexa Takeover
why_it_works: Explores the practical implications of AI in consumer tech
summary: Amazon's acquisition of Bee, an AI wearable, and its expansion of Alexa capabilities highlight its strategy to embed AI into consumer tech. This could change how we interact with devices and information daily.

angle: Apple and Google's collaboration on AI models could significantly enhance consumer tech experiences, but also raises questions about data privacy.

sources.title: Google’s Gemini to power Apple’s AI features like Siri

title: Apple + Google: The AI Partnership That Could Change Everything
why_it_works: Focuses on major tech collaboration and its potential impact
summary: Apple and Google are partnering on AI, with Google’s Gemini models set to power Apple’s AI features. This partnership could lead to major improvements in services like Siri, but also intensifies the spotlight on data privacy.

angle: The struggles of a New Jersey lawsuit highlight the challenges in combating the harmful use of AI in creating deepfake pornography.
title: The Deepfake Dilemma: Legal Battles Against AI Porn
why_it_works: Addresses a controversial and harmful use of AI technology
summary: A New Jersey lawsuit underscores the difficulty of fighting deepfake pornography. While there are laws against it, holding platforms accountable remains a significant challenge, raising questions about regulation and responsibility.
